trans-unit.source: How to use Azure Redis Cache with Java | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use Azure Redis Cache with Java | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Redis Cache using Java
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Redis Cache using Java

trans-unit.source: How to use Azure Redis Cache with Java
trans-unit.target: How to use Azure Redis Cache with Java

trans-unit.source: Azure Redis Cache gives you access to a dedicated Redis cache, managed by Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Azure Redis Cache gives you access to a dedicated Redis cache, managed by Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Your cache is accessible from any application within Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Your cache is accessible from any application within Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to get started with Azure Redis Cache using Java.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to get started with Azure Redis Cache using Java.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Jedis</linkText><title></title></link> - Java client for Redis
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Jedis</linkText><title></title></link> - Java client for Redis

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses Jedis, but you can use any Java client listed at <link><linkText>http://redis.io/clients</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses Jedis, but you can use any Java client listed at <link><linkText>http://redis.io/clients</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Create a Redis cache on Azure
trans-unit.target: Create a Redis cache on Azure

trans-unit.source: In the Azure preview portal, click New, Data + Storage, and select Redis Cache.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure preview portal, click New, Data + Storage, and select Redis Cache.

trans-unit.source: Enter a DNS hostname. It will have the form .redis.cache.windows.net. Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Enter a DNS hostname. It will have the form .redis.cache.windows.net. Click Create.

trans-unit.source: Once you create the cache, click on it in the preview portal to view the cache settings.
trans-unit.target: Once you create the cache, click on it in the preview portal to view the cache settings.

trans-unit.source: Click the link under Keys and copy the primary key.
trans-unit.target: Click the link under Keys and copy the primary key.

trans-unit.source: You need this to authenticate requests.
trans-unit.target: You need this to authenticate requests.

trans-unit.source: Enable the non-SSL endpoint
trans-unit.target: Enable the non-SSL endpoint

trans-unit.source: Click the link under Ports, and click No for "Allow access only via SSL".
trans-unit.target: Click the link under Ports, and click No for "Allow access only via SSL".

trans-unit.source: This enables the non-SSL port for the cache.
trans-unit.target: This enables the non-SSL port for the cache.

trans-unit.source: The Jedis client currently does not support SSL.
trans-unit.target: The Jedis client currently does not support SSL.

trans-unit.source: Add something to the cache and retrieve it
trans-unit.target: Add something to the cache and retrieve it

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Enable cache diagnostics</linkText><title></title></link> so you can <link><linkText>monitor</linkText><title></title></link> the health of your cache.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Enable cache diagnostics</linkText><title></title></link> so you can <link><linkText>monitor</linkText><title></title></link> the health of your cache.

trans-unit.source: Read the official <link><linkText>Redis documentation</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Read the official <link><linkText>Redis documentation</linkText><title></title></link>.
